page.title: 16 AYNHO C.E. SCHOOL
page.content: The village school is closing down on 12th. July,1985 because there are only 12 children aged 4-11yrs. From September, Aynho children will attend Charlton C.E. School. In 1980 there were about 35 children but since the numbers have dropped, there is now only 1 full-time teacher. Founded as a church school in 1813, and housed in an old barn, the school is off The Square. and has a playground orchard, and garden. For the past few years Games and Swimming have been taken with Croughton School. Many visits have been made to different places like Snowdonia, Isle of Wight, London and the canals. During the week teachers visit to take music and environmental studies. The school is also one of a number in the Rural Schools Project with shared facilities like a minibus.
